content.description: Antibiotics interfere with prokaryotic cell functions. Streptomycin is an antibiotic that affects the small ribosomal subunit in prokaryotes. Specifically, streptomycin interferes with the proper binding of <math alttext="t R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>t</mtext><mtext>RN</mtext><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> in prokaryotic ribosomes.
content.question: Which of the following best predicts the most direct effect of exposing prokaryotic cells to streptomycin?

choices.label: Amino acid synthesis will be inhibited.

No <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be transcribed from <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Synthesis of polypeptides will be inhibited.

content.answer: Synthesis of polypeptides will be inhibited.
